items.title: Update web-features tags

items.content_html:
SVG <discard> element is present in FF136, but behind a nightly-enabled pref svg.discard.enabled - see https://bugzilla.mozilla.org/show_bug.cgi?id=1069931. Ditto corresponding API SVGDiscardElement

This modifies the feature to preview.

Related docs work can be tracked in mdn/content#37939
items.title: Firefox Nightly supports SVG discard element, which isn't deprecated

items.content_html: This PR adds the missing WebView iOS statements throughout BCD and sets them to mirror.
items.title: Add mirroring statements for all missing WebView iOS statements

items.content_html:
Summary

This creates more symmetry between font-stretch and font-width data.

Test results and supporting details

  • Adds the <percentage> value to the font-width tree, to match font-stretch and fully cover the expected values and types for font-width.
  • Copies the font-width data into the @font-face tree, as a descriptor.

Related issues

  • #26039
  • #26060
  • web-platform-dx/web-features#2707
items.title: Add more `font-width` data

items.content_html:
The output of the update-browser-releases script is:

@mdn/browser-compat-data@5.6.42 update-browser-releases
tsx scripts/update-browser-releases/index.ts --all

Updates for Chrome for Desktop

Release note not found for 134.

  • New status for chrome 134: current, previously beta.
  • New status for chrome 135: beta, previously nightly.
  • New status for chrome 136: nightly, previously planned.
  • New release date for chrome 136: 2025-04-29, previously undefined.
  • New status for chrome 133: retired, previously current.
  • New release detected for chrome: Version 137 as a planned release.

Updates for Chrome for Android

Release note not found for 134.

  • New status for chrome_android 134: current, previously beta.
  • New status for chrome_android 135: beta, previously nightly.
  • New status for chrome_android 136: nightly, previously planned.
  • New release date for chrome_android 136: 2025-04-29, previously undefined.
  • New status for chrome_android 133: retired, previously current.
  • New release detected for chrome_android: Version 137 as a planned release.

Updates for Webview for Android

Release note not found for 134.

  • New status for webview_android 134: current, previously beta.
  • New status for webview_android 135: beta, previously nightly.
  • New status for webview_android 136: nightly, previously planned.
  • New release date for webview_android 136: 2025-04-29, previously undefined.
  • New status for webview_android 133: retired, previously current.
  • New release detected for webview_android: Version 137 as a planned release.

[!INFO]
Opera for Desktop: No release announcement found among 10 items in this RSS feed.
[!INFO]
Opera for Android: No release announcement found among 14 items in this RSS feed.
items.title: Update browser releases

items.content_html:
Summary

  • Added BCD for single color stop with 0-1 positions for:
    • linear-gradient()
    • conic-gradient()
    • radial-gradient()

Test results and supporting details

  • used https://codepen.io/CodeRedDigital/pen/qEBaeav to test, tested in:
    • Firefox Beta - passed
    • Chrome:
      • Beta - failed
      • Dev - failed
      • Canary - passed
    • Edge:
      • Beta - failed
      • Dev - failed
      • Canary - passed
    • Safari - failed
    • Safari TP - passed
    • Samsung internet - failed

Related issues

  • Allow gradients with a single color stop and 0-1 positions
  • Content PR
  • Firefox Release PR
items.title: Firefox 136 & Chrome/Safari Preview support gradients with single color stop and 0-1 positions

items.content_html:
Summary

Breaking change: Changes the browsers.*.releases property from an object to an array, moving the version number inside the ReleaseStatement.

Test results and supporting details

Related issues

Fixes #21124.
items.title: feat(schemas/browser)!: changes releases from object to array

Test results and supporting details

items.title: Add `ignores_find_in_page` to `inert` global attribute

items.content_html:
Also mark Chrome support as partial due to missing focus behavior

Summary

Mark Safari Tech Preview as partially supporting source option for popover API

Also mark Chrome support as partial due to missing focus behavior

Test results and supporting details

Manually tested STP support by running https://wpt.live/html/semantics/popovers/imperative-invokers.html

Related issues
items.title: Mark Safari Tech Preview as partially supporting source option for popover API

items.content_html:
Summary

HTTP responses with 204, 304, (1XX) should not contain content (a body). For historical / legacy reasons, browsers have tolerated junk data in <=HTTP/1.1 that precedes the status line because servers occasionally included content in responses that should not have a body. HTTP spec versions after 1.1 are strict / explicit in forbidding content in these cases.

I'm removing compat info from prose in MDN docs, and putting this into compat data instead, as this seems the most appropriate place for this to live on.

204 (No Content) is the most obvious place, but I'm open to alternatives somewhere (outside of http/status.json?)

Related issues

  • mdn/content#37928
  • https://bugzilla.mozilla.org/show_bug.cgi?id=1356614
items.title: HTTP responses for status codes that should have no body

items.content_html:
Summary

This PR updates JavaScript builtins support version of Webview Android. Most changes are changing ≤37 or mirror to ≤4.

Test results and supporting details

I wrote a simple tool to determine if the value is undefined to check if the browser supports this feature (only implemented 3 checks so far). Which is available at SessionHu/check-js-feat.
Then I run the server on my another device and open the page on the old Android 4.2 TV with an browser which using Android System Webview.
Here is the result photo (UserAgent on the top, support features in green background, unsupport in red. And I cannot take screenshot on that device):

here 3 photos shot on phone camera



Although the system version is 4.2.1 instead of 4 according to the navigator.userAgent and System Settings. I believe it has the same behavior as 4. Because I did not find Android Webview 4.2 release in /browsers/webview_android.json.

I also do some other tests on that device. But test code were already removed before this PR opened.

Related issues

Not fond yet
items.title: Update Webview Android JS builtins added version

items.content_html:
Summary

Merges the accepts_flags and accepts_webextensions fields in the browser schema into a single accepts object with boolean properties flags and webextensions.

Important

This is a breaking change, as we expose these fields in the built data.json.

Test results and supporting details

Prepares for #25804, which adds webdriver-bidi.

Related issues
items.title: feat(schemas/browsers)!: merge `accepts_{flags,webextension}` fields into `accepts` array

items.content_html:
Summary

Add Firefox release for preferred_environment in the background manifest key as implemented by Bug 1930334 Implement background.preferred_environment.

Related issues

Related MDN content changes in mdn/content#37876
items.title: Firefox 136 supports webextensions.manifest.background.preferred_environment

items.content_html:
Summary

Imports support data for WebDriver BiDi under webdriver.bidi.

Bundled changes:

  • Adds property accepts_webdriver_bidi to browser schema.
  • Uses the property to restrict the data to Chrome/Edge/Firefox/Safari.

Test results and supporting details

The data was extracted using Google Apps Script on a Google Spreadsheet used by WebDriver BiDi folks to track implementation status.

Related issues

Fixes #20207.
items.title: Import WebDriver BiDi data

items.content_html:
Summary

Renames webdriver.commands to webdriver.classic.

Test results and supporting details

Related issues

Part of #20207.
items.title: Rename `webdriver.{commands => classic}`

items.content_html:
Summary

Moves env() from css.properties.custom-property to css.types.

Test results and supporting details

Related issues

Fixes #14668.
items.title: Move CSS `env()`/`var()` functions into `css.types.*`

items.content_html:
Summary

Changes the description of css.types.url from <url> (type) to url() (function), and links css.types.url and css.properties.content.url to Web/CSS/url_function.

Also adds a missing description to css.properties.list-style-type.symbols.

Test results and supporting details

Related issues

Fixes #25413.
items.title: Change `<url>` to `url()` and link to Web/CSS/url_function
